docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This is a FastAPI backend for managing tickets and comments. It provides endpoints for creating, updating, and retrieving ticket information, as well as creating comments related to tickets.

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text: The backend is divided into two domains: Ticket and Comment. The Ticket domain handles ticket-related operations, while the Comment domain handles comment-related operations. Both domains use services (TicketService and CommentService) to encapsulate business logic.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.8 or higher
  • FastAPI 0.92.0 or higher
  • Uvicorn 0.18.3 or higher
  • Pydantic 1.10.2 or higher

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
• Clone the repository using git clone
  • Install dependencies using pip install -r requirements.txt
  • Create a new virtual environment using python -m venv venv
  • Activate the virtual environment using source venv/bin/activate (on Linux/Mac) or venv\Scripts\activate (on Windows)

docs.title: How To Run
docs.text:
• Run the application using uvicorn main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000
  • Access the API documentation at http://localhost:8000/docs
  • Use a tool like curl or Postman to test the API endpoints

docs.title: Usage Examples
docs.text:
• Create a new ticket: POST /tickets with JSON body {"title": "New Ticket", "description": "This is a new ticket"}
  • Get all tickets: GET /tickets
  • Update a ticket's status: PUT /tickets/{id}/status with JSON body {"status": "IN_PROGRESS"}
  • Create a new comment: POST /comments with JSON body {"message": "This is a new comment", "ticket_id": 1}

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The comment management domain is responsible for creating and managing comments related to tickets.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: A system for managing and tracking tickets, including creating, updating, and retrieving ticket information.
